thread.title: Donald Trump Has His Own Theory on What Happened at the Oscars
thread.title_full: Donald Trump Has His Own Theory on What Happened at the Oscars

author: Diana Bruk
title: Donald Trump Has His Own Theory on What Happened at the Oscars
text:
Donald Trump Has His Own Theory About What Happened at the Oscars 
Behold POTUS's hot take on #EnvelopeGate. Most Popular By Diana Bruk Feb 27, 2017 One of the funniest stunts pulled by host Jimmy Kimmel at the Academy Awards last night was a tweet that he legit sent to Donald Trump live from stage: Hey @realDonaldTrump u up? 
— Jimmy Kimmel (@jimmykimmel) February 27, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Trump never responded to the tweet, or commented on the Oscars on Twitter, though he did rail against the New York Times ad that aired on ABC during the show. For first time the failing @nytimes will take an ad (a bad one) to help save its failing reputation. Try reporting accurately & fairly! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 26, 2017 Most Popular It wasn't until an exclusive interview with Breitbart , which apparently took place in the Oval Office, that he shared his thoughts on the snafu-ridden ceremony. "I think they were focused so hard on politics that they didn't get the act together at the end," President Trump said. "It was a little sad. It took away from the glamour of the Oscars. It didn't feel like a very glamorous evening. I've been to the Oscars. There was something very special missing, and then to end that way was sad." The "ending" that he's alluding to would appear to be #EnvelopeGate, in which Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway were handed the wrong envelope while presenting Best Picture, leading them to announce La La Land as the winner, only to then take it back and give the Oscar to the rightful winner, Moonlight . It was certainly one of the most of the most jaw-dropping moments in recent Oscars history, and while the accounting team that counts the ballots has assumed responsibility and issued an apology, it's still unclear how the wrong envelope ended up in Beatty's hand. The Internet is abound with conspiracy theories on how such a major mistake happened, pinning the blame on Leonardo DiCaprio and Russia, or saying it was staged by producers of the show or by Kimmel himself. Now, it seems like Trump has his own hot take: everyone messed up because they are too busy thinking about him to do their jobs! GIF For the record, Trump has indeed been to the Oscars. He and Melania attended the 83rd Academy Awards in 2011. So, there you go.
